alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 16 at 3:50PM CDT until March 16 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL JEFFERSON COUNTY... At 350 PM CDT, Local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Birmingham, Vestavia Hills, Homewood, Mountain Brook, Gardendale, Irondale, Fultondale, Tarrant, Kingston, Birmingham Airport, Five Points South, B.j.c.c., U.A.B. Campus, Regions Field, Ketona Lakes, Samford University, Cahaba Heights, Highland Park Golf Course, Birmingham Zoo and Danville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
